overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a detailed, adaptive approach to forecasting a short hourly time series with daily seasonality. It evaluates multiple methods (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing) but ultimately devises a custom decomposition technique due to data limitations. The solution addresses challenges like negative values and limited historical data (only 4 days) through iterative refinement, though the approach relies heavily on heuristic adjustments.
common_data_patterns: Complete data (no missing values in the given 96 points)
key_insights: Daily seasonality must be addressed for hourly data, but limited cycles (only 4 days) constrain traditional seasonal models
Negative values necessitate additive (not multiplicative) methods for decomposition and forecasting
Trend projection via linear regression on daily averages provides a viable alternative when data is insufficient for complex models
Base pattern replication from the last observed day, adjusted for projected daily level shifts, balances seasonality and trend
complexity_analysis: Highly detailed with multi-step analysis: involves data decomposition, model evaluation, mathematical computations (regression, averaging), and iterative heuristic refinements to overcome data limitations.
